title: How Many Calories in 10 Blackberries?
meta_description: Learn how many calories in 10 blackberries, plus carbs, fiber, sugars, protein, and full nutrition breakdown per berry basis.
assumptions: Fresh, raw blackberries; average size (~5 g each), no added sugars or toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by ripeness, variety, growing conditions, and size. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 10 average blackberries provide ~22 kcal and ~3 g fiber.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Frozen with no added sugar (vs. fresh)

faqs.q: How many calories in one blackberry?
faqs.a: About 2 kcal for an average fresh blackberry.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in 10 blackberries?
faqs.a: Approximately 4.8 g total carbs, including 2.6 g fiber.

faqs.q: Do blackberries have protein or fat?
faqs.a: Low amounts: ~1.4 g protein and 0.5 g fat for 10 berries.
Around 2.6 g dietary fiber, aiding digestion.

faqs.q: Are frozen blackberries higher in calories?
faqs.a: No, similar if unsweetened; added sugars increase calories.
